content: quote: At Least 11 Killed in Alabama Shooting Spree At least 11 people were shot dead Tuesday afternoon in southern Alabama by a lone gunman, according to the FBI. The suspect, identified early Wednesday morning as Michael McLendon of Kinston, Ala., took his own life after leaving a trail of bloodshed across two towns. +http://abcnews.go.com/US/story?id=7052272&page=1 quote: Gunman Kills At Least 15 At German School State officials in Stuttgat said Wednesday that police had shot to death a 17-year-old gunman who killed 15 people in a school shooting in southwestern Germany. Baden Wuerttemburg governor Guenther Oettinger said police shot the suspect after he fled the school. State Interior Minister Heribert Rech said three teachers were among the 15 dead. Police said at least 10 students were also killed in Wednesday's attack. After the initial attack, helicopters searching for the gunmen crisscrossed the area and police warned area residents not to pick anyone up in their cars, but word of his death came soon after the incident. +http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2009/03/11/world/main4858077.shtml WTF over.......
quote: At Least 11 Killed in Alabama Shooting Spree At least 11 people were shot dead Tuesday afternoon in southern Alabama by a lone gunman, according to the FBI. content: quote: German school killer Tim Kretschmer warned of massacre on chatroom The 17-year-old who went on a shooting spree in his former high school in southern Germany yesterday had warned on an internet chatroom the night before that he was going to carry out the attack because "everybody is laughing at me". As Germany mourned the 15 victims of the attack, officials were able to provide the first indications as to what propelled Tim Kretschmer, a computer game and gun enthusiast, to go on the rampage at the school in Winnenden. Heribert Rech, Interior Minister of the state of Baden-Württemberg, told a press conference that the father of a teenager from Bavaria had contacted police to tell them about messages left by Kretschmer on a chatroom based in the United States. "It said something like: 'Everybody is laughing at me. Nobody recognises my potential. I have arms, I have guns, and tomorrow morning I will go to my previous school and show them what I can do," Mr Rech said. (...) Dressed in black special forces fatigues, Kretschmer strode into the school at 9.30 am and began firing. He shot dead nine students – eight of them young girls – and three female teachers before fleeing as police arrived. Most of the victims were shot cleanly in the head. Mr Rech revealed today that Kretschmer had received treatment last year at a psychiatric clinic in Winnenden, to which he fled after the school spree and where he shot dead a gardener before hijacking a Volkswagen Sharan car. He shot another two people at a nearby town before shooting himself in the head after receiving a leg wound in a shootout with police. It emerged today that a simple codeword broadcast into classrooms at the Albertville school is thought to have saved dozens of lives during Kretschmer's shooting spree. As soon as the shooting started, the principal of the school was able to warn teachers by announcing over the school speaker system: "Frau Koma kommt" - or "Mrs Koma is coming." Germans use the word "Amoklauf" – literally "running amok" – to describe school shootings The word "Koma" is "Amok" written backwards so teachers at the school knew immediately what was meant by the message. "Our teacher closed the door and said we should close the windows and sit on the floor," one student, identified only as Kim S., told ZDF television. Officials said that the codeword system was put in place in 2002 after Germany's worst school shooting, when a student from the eastern city of Erfurt killed 16 people, including 13 teachers, before turning the gun on himself. That tragedy prompted the rewriting of Germany's gun laws, raising the minimum age for gun ownership from 18 to 21. (...) "He liked computer games like Counter Strike. My friend, who knew him better and went to his house, said he used to have cardboard figures of people with air guns in his cellar. He shot them in the head." As police investigate the shooting, prosecutors are looking into whether to press charges against Kretschmer's gun-collecting father, who legally owned 15 firearms. Mr Rech said that 14 of the weapons were held in a gun cupboard, secured by an eight-digit combination lock. One, a Beretta 9mm pistol, was kept in his bedroom, and was stolen by the young gunman along with more than 200 rounds of ammunition. “Everything here points to negligence on the part of the father as far as the storage of this weapon is concerned,” said Ralf Michelfelder, a police spokesman. +http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article5894847.ece?token=null&offset=0&page=1

As soon as the shooting started, the principal of the school was able to warn teachers by announcing over the school speaker system: "Frau Koma kommt" - or "Mrs Koma is coming." Germans use the word "Amoklauf" – literally "running amok" – to describe school shootings The word "Koma" is "Amok" written backwards so teachers at the school knew immediately what was meant by the message. "Our teacher closed the door and said we should close the windows and sit on the floor," one student, identified only as Kim S., told ZDF television. Officials said that the codeword system was put in place in 2002 after Germany's worst school shooting, when a student from the eastern city of Erfurt killed 16 people, including 13 teachers, before turning the gun on himself. That tragedy prompted the rewriting of Germany's gun laws, raising the minimum age for gun ownership from 18 to 21. (...) "He liked computer games like Counter Strike. My friend, who knew him better and went to his house, said he used to have cardboard figures of people with air guns in his cellar. He shot them in the head." As police investigate the shooting, prosecutors are looking into whether to press charges against Kretschmer's gun-collecting father, who legally owned 15 firearms. Mr Rech said that 14 of the weapons were held in a gun cupboard, secured by an eight-digit combination lock. One, a Beretta 9mm pistol, was kept in his bedroom, and was stolen by the young gunman along with more than 200 rounds of ammunition. “Everything here points to negligence on the part of the father as far as the storage of this weapon is concerned,” said Ralf Michelfelder, a police spokesman.

title: Shooting Spree(s)

content: Sad news in both cases.

content: quote: Originally posted by Ol_Doc: quote: Originally posted by MaddogK: Guess this 17 y.o. student got some bad grades from one of the 3 dead teachers, eh ? Now who'se gonna be first to say it was the guns fault ? The gun? No one's blaming the gun! The only blame I've read so far is to blame the President of the United States. And Popsiq too: I don't blame the teachers or the weapon, I was simply curious which fanatical gun control nut on this site was going to be the first to blame the manufacturer of the weapon used instead of the real 'culprit'- the father who left a weapon unsecured, and the shooter who 'stole' the weapon and went on a revenge shooting spree to get even for the perceived wrongs against him.
